00026 #ifndef BZ_SHAPECHECK_H
00027 #define BZ_SHAPECHECK_H
00028 
00029 BZ_NAMESPACE(blitz)
00030 
00031 /*
00032  * The function areShapesConformable(A,B) checks that the shapes 
00033  * A and B are conformable (i.e. the same size/geometry).  Typically 
00034  * the A and B parameters are of type TinyVector<int,N_rank> and represent 
00035  * the extent of the arrays.  It's possible that in the future jagged-edged
00036  * arrays will be supported, in which case shapes may be lists
00037  * of subdomains.
00038  */
00039 
00040 template<typename T_shape1, typename T_shape2>
00041 inline bool areShapesConformable(const T_shape1&, const T_shape2&)
00042 {
00043     // If the shape objects are different types, this means
00044     // that the arrays are different ranks, or one is jagged
00045     // edged, etc.  In this case the two arrays are not
00046     // conformable.
00047     return false;
00048 }
00049 
00050 template<typename T_shape>
00051 inline bool areShapesConformable(const T_shape& a, const T_shape& b)
00052 {
00053     // The shape objects are the same type, so compare them.
00054 
00055     // NEEDS_WORK-- once the "all" reduction is implemented, should
00056     // use it.
00057     // return all(a == b);
00058 
00059     for (unsigned i=0; i < a.length(); ++i)
00060     {
00061         if (a[i] != b[i])
00062         {
00063             BZ_DEBUG_MESSAGE("Incompatible shapes detected: " << endl 
00064                  << a << endl << b << endl);
00065             return false;
00066         }
00067     }
00068 
00069     return true;
00070 }
00071 
00072 BZ_NAMESPACE_END
00073 
00074 #endif
